meanings.definition: Having an extreme or irrational fear or aversion to something.
meanings.sent1: She is phobic of spiders and screams whenever she sees one.
meanings.sent2: He has a phobic reaction to heights and refuses to go near the edge of a tall building.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed phobic of the vacuum cleaner, darting away whenever it was turned on.
meanings.sent4: His phobic fear of failure paralyzed him from pursuing his dreams.
meanings.sent5: The dark, ominous clouds overhead cast a phobic shadow over the town.

meanings.definition: A person who has an extreme or irrational fear or aversion to something.
meanings.sent1: The phobic kept his distance from dogs due to his fear of being bitten.
meanings.sent2: She sought therapy to help her cope with being a phobic of public speaking.
meanings.sent3: The phobic clutched onto his lucky charm whenever he felt anxious.
meanings.sent4: The phobic's heart raced as he approached the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The phobic's world shrank as his fears grew larger.
